H0.text: Pathogen is the disease‑causing microorganism that a vector organism carries from one person or animal to another.

H1.text: Microbe is the disease‑causing microorganism that a vector carries from one person or animal to another.

H2.text: Genome is the disease‑causing microorganism that a vector carries from one person or animal to another.

A3.text: In epidemiology, a disease vector is any living agent that carries and transmits an infectious pathogen such as a parasite or microbe, to another living organism.

A4.text: The pathogen is spread to new hosts from the vector during subsequent blood meals.
